alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 5:39PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Sussex and southeastern Caroline Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Preston to near Vienna to Hebron. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seaford, Laurel, Federalsburg, Bridgeville, Delmar, Preston, Sycamore, Gumboro, Blades and Bethel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
